concept.title: Security
concept.shortdesc: Security is the means by which you maintain privacy and protect information assets.

conbody.p: includes a number of security mechanisms:

li.p: Role Based Access Control (RBAC)—User roles determine what operations a user can perform. For example, only users with a role of can configure the system and construct datasets, while only users with a role of can query data and execute or export a dataset.
Configurable Password Policy— allows you to configure the password policy that defines how strong user passwords have to be and how they must be changed.

Audit Log— maintains complete a audit log of system and user operations. The log includes all create, modify, and delete operations, plus a record of all queries made to the system. The audit log file is completely tamperproof for all users.

Encryption in motion— assumes your system is deployed on a trusted network. However, you can encrypt links from data sources and to consuming applications and analytics tools using either Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) or Transport Layer Security (TLS).
